We will continue to send updates via robo-call, email and text messaging to all District families. All update letters from Dr. Montesano are posted in the new COVID-19 RESPONSE webpage, for reference. All COVID-19 Announcements are also posted in the COVID-19 RESPONSE web page. Please check it regularly.

Our Tech Help Desk has been updated in response to the volume of tech assistance needed by our families in English, Spanish and Haitian Creole. If you have not received a District-issued device and need one for your child's Remote Learning Plan, call the TECH HELP DESK at 845-353-7075 or, use this NEW TECH HELP DESK FORM for quick-access assistance. Click on the link, fill out the form and submit. A tech assistant will contact you within 24 hours:

Soporte Técnico y de Apoyo Digital para la Familia y Estudiantes

Sistèm pou Ede Fanmi ak Elèv yo nan Teknoloji




Thank you for your continued collaboration as we work together to keep all families informed and connected during this unique and challenging time.

img.div: Building Bridges for today's students to cross into tomorrow's world with Equity, Innovation & Optimism

div.h3: April 20th:This COVID-19 RESPONSE PAGE has been created to house important information, improve communication & stay connected with you

em.strong: This web page is a work-in-progress. Please peruse and check regularly for District Updates:
We will continue to send updates via robo-call, email and text messaging to all District families.
Extension of School Closure dates will continue to be posted in the Alert Box located at the top of the District's webpage(s).
All Update Letters from Dr. Montesano are posted in the Superintendent's Update Box, for reference.
Thank you for your continued collaboration as we work together for District Communications during these unique and challenging times.

div.h3: Take a Look & Listen: The April 16th Community Zoom Meeting has been posted

li.a: Zoom Meeting with the Superintendent of Nyack Public Schools-3.pdf

div.h3: United Way of Rockland has published a COVID-19 Community Resource Guide, attached here for your convenience

div.p:
Table of Contents includes:
Food Pantries & Feeding Programs; Grocery Stores & Pharmacies; Testing Locations; Behavioral Health Support Services; Health Insurance and Prescription Assistance; Unemployment Insurance & Pandemic Unemployment; Child Care;Utilities; Housing; Banking & Student Loans

div.h3: On April 13th, a new Tech Help Form was posted to provide quick access to tech assistance in English, Spanish and Haitian Creole

p.strong: to the volume of tech assistance needed by our families in English, Spanish and Haitian Creole.
If you have not received a District-issued device and need one for your child's Remote Learning Plan, call the
TECH HELP DESK at 845-353-7075 or fill out the NEW Tech Help Form located on this page in the TECH SUPPORT Box.

div.h3: On April 7th, a letter from Dr. Montesano was sent to parent/guardians of 7-12 graders regarding cancellation of June 2020 Regents Exams

li.a: 7 de abril actualizacion importante y carta del Dr Montesano.pdf
April 7 Letter to Grades 7-12 Parent Guardians Regarding NYS Regents Exams(1).pdf

div.h3: On April 6th, the NYS Dept. of Education released a series of Emergency Regulations to ease the burdens of educators, students...

p.strong: ... and professionals in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Click on the link below to view NYSED
"Acts on a Series of Emergency Regulations to Ease the Burdens of Educators Students and Professionals in the Wake of COVID-10 Pandemic":

div.p: THE BOE TRUSTEE ELECTION AND BUDGET VOTE HAS BEEN DELAYED DUE TO COVID-19. ADDITIONAL DETAILS PENDING AND ONCE CONFIRMED WILL BE REVISED AND POSTED.

em.strong: "Just as we believe that all children are capable learners, we must “turn the mirror inward” and put focus on our own continued learning to build the human capacity and will to make a difference. When we understand that all children are our children and we see each child pursuing their full potential, we will see a brighter future."

div.p: A Message from the Superintendent for the 2019-20 School Year: Sixty five years after Supreme Court’s decision in Brown vs. BOE, America’s schools are more segregated by race and class (U.S. Govt. Accountability Office, 2016). Our Nation’s racial and ethnic composition is rapidly changing. Among people aged eighty and over in the 2010 U.S. Census, more than 80% were white, but only 52% were white among those aged 5 or younger (Ferguson, 2013). Being mindful of what data trends indicate, what are the implications for our Nation if we are unable to close a persistent achievement gap?

In Nyack Public Schools, our fundamental goal is to prepare every child to develop their full potential for living in our society of today and tomorrow. This moral imperative guides a shift in thinking we are compelled to make if we are to realize the success of each child. As we deepen our collective understanding of equity, we are asking an essential question: How do we work together to establish a culture that embraces diversity, respects all cultures, and ensures the development and implementation of educational programs that maximize academic achievement of all students regardless of race or socio-economics?

As we face a new school year, we are optimistic about changes and challenges it is sure to bring. We ask all members of our school community to join us in envisioning equity together. We will continue to take risks by closely examining the role we each play in changing a system that has allowed unacceptable disproportionality of outcomes, opportunity and achievement to persist within this District. Just as we believe that all children are capable learners, we must “turn the mirror inward” and put focus on our own continued learning to build the human capacity and will to make a difference. When we understand that all children are our children and we see each child pursuing their full potential, we will see a brighter future.
Join Us in a shared vision of excellence in education with equity, innovation and optimism.
Tell us what you think. We are listening and want to keep our community engaged in authentic communication. Let's Talk!
